publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2068 George Lyon: Over 30 Months Scheme—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive and the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs to follow the advice of the Food Standards Agency and bring to an end, with the full endorsement of the chief medical officers, the Over Thirty Months Scheme on a UK-wide basis which will lead to rapid progress on quality Scottish beef once again being available to consumers across Europe. Supported by: Jeremy Purvis*, John Farquhar Munro*, Iain Smith*, Mr Keith Raffan*

S2M-2068 George Lyon: Over 30 Months Scheme—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive and the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs to follow the advice of the Food Standards Agency and bring to an end, with the full endorsement of the chief medical officers, the Over Thirty Months Scheme on a UK-wide basis which will lead to rapid progress on quality Scottish beef once again being available to consumers across Europe. Supported by: Jeremy Purvis, John Farquhar Munro, Iain Smith, Mr Keith Raffan
S2M-2068 Over 30 Months Scheme (lodged on 24 November 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2068 Over 30 Months Scheme (lodged on 24 November 2004) Donald Gorrie*
